se.kth.peiyan.cimCracker

Class DataAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.kth.peiyan.cimCracker.DataAnalyzer

  • public class DataAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
    this class is responsible for:
    • Database connection,
    • read metadata (table, column) and data from database
    • create new table in a database
    • populate table in database
    • get the 'name' attributes from specific table
    • prepare clustering objects; add and populate 'dataObjects' table into database.
    • calculate centroid for each class; add and populate 'clust_xx' table into database.

      • updateDataObjects

        public java.util.ArrayList<DataObject> updateDataObjects(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> selectedAttributes,
                                                         java.lang.String tableName)

        update database: adding and populating 'dataObjects' table into database.

        return internal data structure ArrayList<DataObject> representing data objects

        Parameters:
        selectedAttributes - specific which attributes (got from 'name' from 'analog_means' table) shall be added into the 'dataObjects' table
        tableName - specific table where one can fetch the corresponding data, usually the same 'tableName' used in 'getNames()' method
        Returns:
        ArrayList<DataObject> a list of data objects with dimensions of attributes

      • updateCluster

        public java.util.ArrayList<Centroid> updateCluster(java.util.ArrayList<DataObject> dataObjects,
                                                   int kNumber,
                                                   boolean isRandomInitializationNeeded)

        update database: adding and populating 'clust_xx' table into database.

        return internal data structure ArrayList<Centroid> representing a list of cluster centroids

        Parameters:
        dataObjects -
        kNumber -
        isRandomInitializationNeeded -
        Returns:
        ArrayList<Centroid> a list of centroids representing the centroid of each cluster
